channel.title: Projects on Zalando Research
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Zalando Research

item.title: Improving Fashion Item Encoding and Retrieval
item.description: Team members: Christian Bracher Sebastian Heinz Unlike a brick-and-mortar department store, online retailers like Zalando must use digital representations of their offerings to entice customers. Traditionally, this takes the form of information stored in a catalog database, which collects categorical properties (tags), numerical descriptors (e.g., prices), and images of the items. Although this information is curated by in-house experts, assignments are often subjective (what makes a dress ‘dark red,’ or ‘leisure’?
